question.text: A square coil ACDE with its plane vertical is released from rest in a horizontal uniform magnetic field B →  of length 2L. The acceleration of the coil is

options.text: less than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi></math> for all the time till the loop crosses the magnetic field completely.

less than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi></math> when it enters the field and greater than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi></math> when it comes out of the field.

less than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi></math> when enters and comes out of the field but equal to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi></math> when it is within the field.

solution.text: When the coil is within the field, there is no change in magnetic flux passing through it. Thus, no current will be induced and the acceleration will be <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi></math>. But according to Lenz's law, the induced current will oppose its motion when it enters or leaves the field. Therefore, acceleration will be less than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi></math>.
